content: Does anyone know if there's an existing issue for increasing the PHP version for testing? Seems like we need to move to 7.3 or so.
I don't know if there's a separate issue for it, but it has been discussed in at least a couple of issues.

I remember someone mentioning that there's no test box version that provides php 5.3 together with something newer than php 7.0.
Additionally there's a small bug with the command line installer and php versions above 7.1 (https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4111)

PHP warning: Headers already sent 路 Issue #4111 路 backdrop/backdrop-issues
When installing Backdrop using ./core/scripts/install.sh I see lots of the following warnings: PHP Warning: ini_set(): Headers already sent. You cannot change the session module's ini settings ...
I'm guessing the issue should go into backdrop-ops
I have no idea where to put it. Is there a project for the testing infrastructure?
there are two issues - increase the PHP 7.x version for testing; and possibly increase from 5.3 to 5.6 (match WP's minimum?)
